All I want to do is play league and all I have done so far is read the patch notes about 20 times

"To be **blunt**, we were dubious about the idea of introducing so much change to the game..."

Sneaky... {{summoner:14}}

420? 4+2 is 6. There are two letters, so divide by 2. 6/2 is 3. What has three sides? A triangle. Now only zero is left. If you turn zero on its side, it looks like an eye.
Eye in a triangle? Illuminati. Illuminati worship Satan. Satan is {{champion:17}}. {{champion:17}} is furry. Who else is furry? {{champion:75}} is furry. {{champion:75}} is doge. Doge is love. Doge is life. Life.
{{champion:16}} used to restore life much more easily. She also used to restore mana. Mana regen. This patch messes with mana regen. Tear of the goddess restores mana. Tears. Tears are partially salt. Salt crystallizes. Crystallization. Crystal meth.
Crystal meth is addictive and bad for your health. League is addictive and bad for your health.
Riot is secretly behind league guys. I figured it out.

>420? 4+2 is 6. There are two letters, so divide by 2. 6/2 is 3.

Half Life 3 Confirmed

FINALLY

It pisses me off that they removed the {{item:1057}}. All the items that used said {{item:1057}} now have reduced magic resist. As a tank/support player, do you know how hard it is to build magic resist already?!?
Force of Nature #neverforget
Only Mecerial Scimitar and Abysall Scepter have reduced MR the rest get theirs on back on completion of the item
If i'm reading it correctly, abyssal has increased mr.
LESS PATCH NOTES MORE NA SERVER RUNNING
this^^

Best Patch Ever! 

The only thing I have an issue with is they removed the only AD item that applies grievous wound.{{item:3123}} I didn't use this item much but when you have the crazy Olafs or high sustain carries its nice to have an item to bail you out if you didn't take ignite.

I concur. If I were not playing Miss Fortune or Tristana, then I would always get an Avarice Blade to build into the Executioner's Calling. When ADCs (and AD melee assassins) just stack lifesteal (when lifesteal were no longer UNIQUE on items) so they can effectively tank-by-sustain while also deliver high damage, the EC pretty much countered those kinds of builds, without having to resort to the same lifesteal-stacking troll build.

Also, this just elevates some ADC champs over others who don't have *grievous wounds *or similar mechanics in their kits, i.e. Tristana is now one more step above than her already high tier.

Still, with the new way of how health regen is going into this new season, I'll take a wait-&-see approach before crying foul.
Great now i can't buy executioners calling against the heavy healer/lifesteal/regen monster teams.
Corporate {{champion:36}} had to remove his only competition

I like how Banner of Command makes a minion immune to magic damage but it also gives it MR.
The MR is a passive aura, independant from the activated.
pretty sure you're wrong since it is listed under the active along side increased size.
{{summoner:14}} {{summoner:14}} {{summoner:14}} 4.20
{{champion:63}}
Solwolf is going to be sad to see Sword of the Divine gone.

My only concern with moving forward with League as an adaptable and strategic game it the option of choice.  The changes to smite are great until the ultimatum stating one cannot purchase a machete without smite.

A Jungler forgetting smite on the off chance would now have to adapt even further and would be farther behind then necessary.  On the other hand, a jungler purposefully not choosing smite for whatever blaspheme reasons is not allowed, forcing Junglers to have smite no matter what.

I may be wrong, but isn't this imposing on your players how they should play the game instead of letting them create the best strategy themselves?
**Finally** I won't feel like a retard when I {{summoner:11}} a champion.
RIP in peace {{item:3005}} I'll never forget how good you were on {{champion:14}}
After game lobby gifting? Rito I can't even afford to buy nice things for myself {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}} RIP the wallet I never had

Removing Executioner's Calling seems like a mistake to me. 

Also, are all these changes just to rift, or will these also be applied to treeline? Mainly the jungle items and removing of Executioner's Calling. 

On the tree line Executioner's Calling is a common build for me, used to shut down fiora and aatrox among other high life steal/regen champs.
What else is there to do when the server has been down for 18 hours?
Holy Patch Notes Batman!

alright patch 4.20, let's see what Riot has in store for us on this glorious patch:

"To be **blunt**"
okay...
"we were **dubious**"
go on...
"P.S. We visually updated everyone's favorite tree! **Play tree every day.**"
Well played riot.  This is now officially the best league of legends patch yet! {{champion:63}} {{champion:57}} {{champion:32}}

Uhh, I think Rito did the math wrong on fountain regen. 2.1% max health per .25 seconds is 8.4% max health regen in 1 second. That's .1% less healing...Overall, the fountain healing is going to be slower but will heal on faster intervals. I honestly don't understand this change one bit.

A continuous healing is better. To get out faster or just in time when you are in a rush so you don't have to wait a whole second. Also when they bully you at your own base lol it will be harder for them to kill you since i have killed enemies when they are at their fountain. We all have xD

This is the patch everyones been waiting for {{summoner:14}} BLAZE IT
